meanings.definition: Silly or trivial talk or writing.
meanings.sent1: Stop all that twaddle and focus on your work.
meanings.sent2: I can't stand listening to such twaddle during meetings.
meanings.sent3: The children's twaddle about unicorns made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was filled with twaddle, clouding her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The book was full of twaddle, making it hard to take seriously.

meanings.sent1: Don't believe everything you hear; most of it is just twaddle.
meanings.sent2: His explanation was nothing but twaddle, lacking any logic.
meanings.sent3: The twaddle in the comedy show had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like twaddle, easily seen through by her parents.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was pure twaddle, deceiving the public.
